jesuspd615: It’s unhealthy to not monitor your weight if you’re obese. Don’t believe me? Ask a doctor.
dontaskalex: I’m a plus size woman, always have been and likely always will be, so I understand your struggle. I’ve also struggled with eating disorders and mental health issues. I hate the idea of being policed when you’re just trying to exist, and the idea of plus size women “promoting obesity” for simply existing on social media is disgusting. Im not saying you do this, but, there is something to be said for promoting the idea that you can be healthy when morbidly obese. I believe in loving yourself at any size, and I know that getting to a “healthy weight” or BMI can be extremely difficult. Lately I’ve struggled with plus size women promoting the idea that being super obese is OK, purely from a medical and statistical standpoint, because there are a lot of serious health issues that can arise, including death, from this. Does this not send the wrong message to followers? This is in no way meant to be an attack, but simply an attempt to understand. Where do we draw the line between self love and acceptance, and refusal to acknowledge the damaging effects that being extremely overweight can have?
